questions.question_text: What is the purpose of the Workspace ONE UEM Security Pin?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
A should be correct

choices.A: Serves as a second layer of security for administrators while preventing inadvertent commands.
choices.B: Provides a second factor of authentication for administrators during console login.
choices.D: Serves as a second layer of security for end users while preventing inadvertent commands.
choices.C: Provides multi-factor authentication for users during device enrollment.

questions.question_text: Which three are features in the branding section of the Workspace ONE Access console? (Choose three.)

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: ACD
ACD should be OK (https://docs.vmware.com/en/VMware-Workspace-ONE-Access/services/ws1_access_service_administration_cloud/GUID-2B71B33C-DDA2-4A20-A0C8-DA723A982C34.html).

Selected Answer: ACD
Link provided was broken, the updated link that supports the answer is here:
https://docs.vmware.com/en/VMware-Workspace-ONE-Access/services/ws1_access_service_administration_cloud/GUID-2B71B33C-DDA2-4A20-A0C8-DA723A982C34.html

comments.content:
Well I don't see "Uploading a favicon to display in the browser address bar" in your link. 
Should be BCD

Literally the first paragraph:
"You can customize the appearance of the Workspace ONE Access console header and sign-in screen. You can add a company name, product name, and favicon to the address bar. You can also customize the user sign-in page to set background colors to match your company's colors and logo design."

choices.D: Uploading a logo for sign-in screens.
choices.E: Adjusting the URL of the Access console.
choices.A: Uploading a favicon to display in the browser address bar.
choices.B: Adjusting the name of the Intelligent Hub application on devices.

questions.question_text: Which two Workspace ONE edge services on Unified Access Gateway does VMware require to use 3rd party SSL certificates? (Choose two.)

comments.content:
Correct, you can find this line in the techzone document saying you can use either the UEM or a 3rd party certificate.

"These ports are secured with a Workspace ONE UEM-issued tunnel certificate, issued from the device root certificate in your Workspace ONE UEM environment or a public third-party SSL certificate."

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: AE
A E is correcot. in VPN we can use Airwatch cert

Selected Answer: BD
BD
"The default port for Tunnel Proxy is 2020 and the default port for Per-App Tunnel is 443. When TLS Port Sharing is disabled, the Per-App Tunnel default port is 8443.

These ports are secured with a Workspace ONE UEM-issued tunnel certificate, issued from the device root certificate in your Workspace ONE UEM environment or a public third-party SSL certificate."

comments.content: You are correct, B is de answer.

discussion.content:
For me is D, WS1 UEM because is where you active the service.
After that, work with WS1 Access

comments.content:
"The Workspace ONE Hub Services component is co-located with Workspace ONE Access and is dependent on Workspace ONE Access for shared services."
Source: https://docs.vmware.com/en/VMware-Workspace-ONE/services/intelligent-hub_IDM/GUID-1D3018CE-8716-4960-B16B-696D1F2B7E50.html#:~:text=The%20Workspace%20ONE%20Hub%20Services%20component%20is%20co-located,the%20Workspace%20ONE%20Intelligent%20Hub%20app%20on%20devices.

questions.question_text: Where is Hub Services component co-located?

An administrator would like to import Public Applications acquired from the Microsoft Store for Business.
Which configuration is required?
